article.Heading: Revenue Secy panel suggests Rs 11,000 cr healthcare scheme: Srcs
article.Summary: The panel has put forth suggestions for universal life and health insurance schemes to the Finance Minister and Prime Minister.
article.Body:
A Revenue Secretary-led panel has recommended a Rs 11,000 crore mega healthcare scheme, sources say.

As per the recommendations made, the Centre’s contribution will be Rs 6,600 crore and states will be Rs 4,400 crore for the scheme.

The panel has put forth suggestions for universal life and health insurance schemes to the Finance Minister and Prime Minister.

CNBC-TV18’s Nayantara Rai, quoting sources, says that coverage of Rs 2 lakh could be fixed for life insurance and moot health coverage of Rs 50,000 per family and Rs 30,000 per senior citizen could be added.

The schemes may be implemented via private and public health service providers. A moot health cess on demerit goods will be one of the sources for funds for the government, says the source.

The panel has also recommended bulk procurement of 3000 drugs, which will be available for free to poor, says the source.

The panel has also suggested opening 1,000 stores in 2016 to sell generic drugs at low cost. These stores could be opened via public private partnership (PPP) model, source says.
